abstract: Several of the world’s biggest banks are in talks to put up about $75 billion in backup financing that could be used to buy risky mortgage securities and other assets.
snippet: Several of the world’s biggest banks are in talks to put up about $75 billion in backup financing that could be used to buy risky mortgage securities and other assets.
lead_paragraph: Several of the world’s biggest banks are in talks to put up about $75 billion in a backup fund that could be used to buy risky mortgage securities and other assets, a move designed to ease pressure on a crucial part of the credit markets that threatens the broader economy.

headline.main: Banks May Pool Billions to Avert Securities Sell-Off
headline.print_headline: Banks May Pool Billions To Avert Securities Sell-Off
